bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of Document.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: In the US. District Court, District of Nebraska 2978
See the matter of the Habeas Corpus of "Till" vs Milton Willerford
In the United States Court Disctrict of Nebraska
In Re "Till", matter of the application of M. O. Reicketts for the writ of Habeas Corpus against Milton Willerford
And now comes its said Milton Willerford according with command of said writ and produces at court the body of said "Till" who has been in his custody for the past seven years and says

That he has never purchased or claimed to have purchased said boy "Till" and has never claimed to own him as a slave or otherwise; that on his contrary said "Till" has lived with his as a member of his family during said time of his own free will, and now resides as a member of Willerford's family of his own will.
That Milford has never abused or ill treated said boy in any manner and has never deprived him of his liberty
and the respondent Milton Willerford denies each and every other allegation in the petition contained accepting such written as are herein admitted to be true
Wherefore respondent prays that the action may be dismissed and sealed he recovers his costs
Milton Willerford respondent by L.N.Facky his attorney
State of Nebraska, Doughlas County } ss.
L.N.Facky bring fully that he is attorney for respondent herein and that the fact and allegation in the and aneww and this as his family herein. L.N.Facky
11th day of November 1890 E.S. Dundy Jr. Clerk
